intro: Fleischmannia cajamarcensis, commonly known as the Peruvian nightshade, is a species native to the Andean region of Peru. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple, blooming at night. Its fruit is a fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and lesser-known member of the nightshade family.
